Emerging growth company&#160;&#160; &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act.&#160;&#160; &#9744; &#160; &#160; Item&#160;8.01. Other Events. In September 2013 and January 2014, Hock Tan, President and Chief Executive Officer of Broadcom Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;), was granted options to purchase an aggregate of 2.5 million shares of Company common stock (the &#8220;Options&#8221;), which have fully vested and which expire in September 2020 and January 2021, respectively. As a result, on October 1, 2019, Mr. Tan adopted a pre-arranged stock trading plan (&#8220;10b5-1 Plan&#8221;) to exercise the balance of these expiring Options and to automatically sell the resulting shares. Under the 10b5-1 Plan, Mr. Tan is expected to sell an aggregate of 1.9 million shares in multiple pre-scheduled sales, over a period of 12 months starting in January 2020. Mr. Tan continues to hold a long-term, multi-year performance stock unit award, granted in June 2017, under which he may earn a maximum of 756,000 shares of Company common stock (the &#8220;2017 Award&#8221;). The 2017 Award may be earned, if at all, over two overlapping performance periods of three and four years, ending in June 2020 (&#8220;Period 1&#8221;) and June 2021 (&#8220;Period 2&#8221;), based on the Company&#8217;s total stockholder return performance as compared to the S&#038;P 500 over such periods (&#8220;Relative TSR&#8221;). Mr. Tan may earn shares under the 2017 Award, as follows: up to 252,000 shares with respect to each of Period 1 and Period 2 if the Company&#8217;s Relative TSR is at the 75th percentile of the S&#038;P 500 Index companies and up to an aggregate of 756,000 shares (inclusive of shares earned in both performance periods) if the Company&#8217;s Relative TSR is at or above the 90th percentile of the S&#038;P 500 Index companies for Period 2. The 2017 Award is subject to the terms and conditions of a Performance Share Unit Award Agreement, dated June&#160;15, 2017, between the Company and Mr.&#160;Tan (the &#8220;PSU Agreement&#8221;) and the Avago Technologies Limited 2009 Equity Incentive Award Plan (the &#8220;2009 Plan&#8221;), and the foregoing description of the 2017 Award is qualified in its entirety by reference to the PSU Agreement, a copy of which is filed was previously filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the &#8220;SEC&#8221;) (see Exhibit 10.1 to Broadcom Limited&#8217;s Current Report on Form 8-K filed with the SEC on June&#160;19, 2017), and to the 2009 Plan, a copy of which was previously filed with the SEC (see Exhibit 10.18 to Avago Technologies Limited&#8217;s Registration Statement on Form S-1/A previously filed with the SEC on July&#160;27, 2009).
